wake_up: ^Everything is dark, except the stars you can see through a very large window.

c-0: ^Out of the window there's only... space.
^You are floating in the middle of an apparently endless abyss.
c-1: ^You are in an empty room, in which there is only a bizarre machine dripping with thick water.
^The machine sports a big red button on its wet glass-like surface.

wipe_machine: ^The surface of the machine has a series of four look-through areas.
^Through three of those small square windows you can see people buried in the machine.
^They look like they're dead, or sleeping very deeply.
press_machine_button: ^As soon as you press the red button on the

b: ^It's such a relief that the alarm is off now.
^ The presence of the three corpses, or mysterious sleeping people, still makes you feel uneasy.

voice: ^Suddenly, you hear a voice coming from nowhere.

b: ^ The alarm sound makes it hard to understand the words.

voice: ^Voice "It's OK if you feel a bit confused."
^Voice "You are only 7,530 days into your journey."

c-1: ^"Who and why stuffed three lifeless bodies in this room?"
^Voice "They are fine, and alive - in a way."
^Voice "Those three people are your hibernated crew, Captain."
^You have no idea what she or it is talking about.
^Voice "I can explain why I had to reactivate you."
^The Voice makes it sound as if waking you up implies a calamity.
c-3: ^Voice "There is a little problem about that."

c-1: ^"I can resist for some more time."

c-5: ^You don't feel like talking to a computer right now.

open_door: ^The Voice seems to be in a hurry.
^A door panel opens, silently sliding upwards.

c-0: ^Still uncertain about why you are obeying this Voice, you comply.

The_Corridor: ^The corridor has no windows and, apparently, no artificial lights.
^You would need something to see in the darkness.
^You proceed using the weak lighting from the room you just left.
^The corridor seems very long and it gets darker and darker the more you walk into it.
^Voice "I detect your hydration level is critical."
^Voice "There are water supplies in the emergency crate on your left."
^You didn't even realise there was a crate there.
^Voice "But I suggest that you keep it for later and the rest of the crew."

b: ^ You don't believe you've ever felt as thirsty as you feel now, not once in your entire life.
^ You really don't feel like drinking anymore.

s0: ^The crate is closed, but emergency supplies are never locked.
^You open the crate and pick a water bulb.
^It's designed to work in zero gravity, but this feature is not needed now.
^Apparently, you are at half g; the ship must be spinning, as it was when you hibernated.

c-1: ^You drink another one but you feel like you cannot be less thirsty than this.

enough_drinking: ^You suddenly realise that, distracted by your thirst, you passed over a significant statement by the Voice.
^"What about the rest of the crew?"
^"Why should we be waking them up?"
^A sudden rush of memories fills your mind.
^Now you kind of know who you are.

c-0: ^Voice "Please, Captain, I can explain while you walk."
g-0: ^The Voice sounded hesitating before pronouncing three uncanny words.
^A sinister, deafening metallic howl resounded in the hollow corridor.

c-2: ^You can hardly see the walls now.
^You can only proceed by feeling around.

The_Labyrinth: ^The starship is rotating to simulate gravity.
^You are now walking in the same direction as its rotation, which space travellers call "rotationwise" as opposed to "counterrotationwise".

southwest_up: ^You are by the emergency crate again.

b: ^This section of the corridor gets darker and darker the farther you move from the room where you woke up.
^This section of the corridor gets brighter and brighter the closer you get to the hibernation room.
^Finally, you reach the open door and you're back in the room where you woke up.

s0: ^You stumble on something and you almost fall down a hole.

west_up: ^here's a "downward" passage in the middle of the corridor floor.

s0: ^It feels like "downward" but it's just "outward" respective of the starship's axis of rotation.

west_up: ^A metal ladder runs along the passage.

c-0: ^You climb down for a short time, until you reach a lower area.
^The gravity is a bit stronger here, farther from the rotation axis.

c-2: ^You climb up again, which feels both tiring and pointless.

b: ^You don't really understand what's on the walls of this section of the corridor. They feel like rectangular glass frames.
^ The walls of this section of the corridor were devoted to a kind of hall of fame, with pictures of the crew from their Earth times

s0: ^, their families and friends, their old lives
^You can't watch yours, it hurts too much.
s1: ^You are tempted to check yours, but you don't.

c-0: ^You climb down for a short time, until you reach a lower area.
^The gravity is a bit stronger here, farther from the rotation axis.

c-2: ^You climb up again, which feels both tiring and pointless.

northeast_up: ^You cannot walk on, you have to turn back.
east_up: ^ until you reach the spot where the downward tunnel departs from the corridor's floor.
^As you know, the radial passage has no ladder here.
^You can still crawl down holding to a series of handles along the tunnel walls.

c-0: ^You climb down for a short time, until you reach a lower area.
^The gravity is a bit stronger here, farther from the rotation axis.

c-2: ^You climb up again, which feels both tiring and pointless.

southeast_up_find_out: ^This corridor section is a bit shorter, because it abruptly ends in a closed sliding door.

c-0: ^"Can you tell me what's behind this door?"
^Voice "Yes, sir. It's another, one-way entrance to the hibernation room."
c-1: ^You notice there's a peephole on the door.
^You place your eye on it, and you realise that this is another entrance to the hibernation room.
g-0: ^This spaceship is shaped like a cylinder, rotating about its axis.
^If you walk straight along one of its wheel-shaped corridors, you end up where you started.

b: ^ This is the shorter stretch of corridor that reaches the other door of the hibernation room.

c-0: ^The door handle is replaced by a biometric finger scan.
^You press your thumb on it and the door slides open.
^Immediately after you walk in, the door closes behind you with a soft clatter.
c-1: ^There is a toolbox hanging on the wall.
^You open it and, to your great joy, it contains a torchlight!
^There are also a wrench, a band-aid and a few other emergency gadgets.
^You take everything and switch on the torchlight.

hibernation_room: ^The room looks exactly like you left it.
^ lighten the room from an impressive window.

s0: ^The landscape is constantly shifting because of the spaceship's rotation, of course.

b:
^You can only exit from the sliding panel you already used.

^Unless that panel there is another door… but you see no handle or lock.

c-1: ^Voice "That door is one-way, you can only use it to walk in."
^Voice "People get confused sometimes when they end their hibernation."
^Voice "You don't want to choose between two doors when you feel like that."
^You leave the room using the main sliding door.

s0: ^hurt your leg on a cubic object.

c-0: ^You dim the torchlight with your hand, to prevent the robot from following you.
c-1: ^You show the path to the robot with your torchlight.

south_down: ^There are locked personal cupboards and closed sliding doors along the corridor walls.

b: ^ The signs on the doors read "Hibernation ER", "Chemistry Lab", "Biological Storage" etc.

south_down: ^Voice "Those doors were also forcibly blocked when the lights were shut down."
^This section of the corridor runs for much longer before anything relevant
^You recognise an elevator door on the
elevator: ^You could try and call the elevator. Or just leave.

b: ^ The cleaner robot reaches you and looks in your direction with its main camera.

c-0: ^Voice "I'D RATHER NOT bring the elevator here for you."
^ cannot help you, or any other sentient being, reach "them".
c-1: ^"Cleaner, go back to your recharge station."
^The cleaner robot leaves you and the torchlight, quickly moving into the darkness.
^It's following its own path in reverse.
^Apparently, its fear of darkness is overriden by the instinct to reach the charging station.

c-0: ^It heard you and comes back at your side.

c-2: ^The cleaner robot slowly drives towards the elevator door and gently taps it.
^Voice "Automated cleaner is authorised to leave the level."
^You can almost feel the Voice winking at you.
^You follow the robot closely and enter the elevator along with it.

north_down: ^There is a ladder reaching the upper level through a "vertical" tunnel.

c-0: ^You climb up for a short time, until you reach the upper area.
^The gravity is a bit weaker here, because you are closer to the rotation axis.

s0: ^It's less of an effort than climbing up. Exactly like your Physics teacher would say.

west_down: ^There is a ladder reaching the upper level through a "vertical" tunnel.

c-0: ^You climb up for a short time, until you reach the upper area.
^The gravity is a bit weaker here, because you are closer to the rotation axis.

b: ^a tunnel that, strangely, has no ladder but handles on the walls.

east_down: ^The corridor, however, continues after the junction.

b: ^You feel too tired and dehydrated for this climb.

^You feel tired and dehydrated, this climb is going to kill you.

^However, the water supplies are depleted and you need to gather all your forces.

^You can do it.

c-0: ^You climb up until you reach the upper area.
^The gravity is a bit weaker here, because you are closer to the rotation axis.

c-2: ^You climb down again, almost letting yourself fall.

b: ^After some walking, you hit something. It's soft but immovable and fills the entire corridor.
^Emergency protective foam fills the entire corridor.

s1: ^You still wonder what caused this mess.

s0: ^There must have been a breach that was automatically repaired by the starship's disaster recovery systems.

b: ^You can feel the slightly elevated frames of sliding doors on one side of the corridor.
^There is no way to open them.
^Voice "In case are wondering, those doors were forcibly blocked when the lights were shut down."
^You see a series of closed sliding doors along one side of the corridor.
^They lead to medical facilities but you cannot access them because everything is in lockdown.
^On the other side of the corridor, you know that there is the vacuum of deep space beyond the thick walls of metal and the ceramic shielding.
^The black sky must be filled with the colours of stars and galaxies.
^Unfortunately, no window opens on that wondrous view.

^By carefully touching the metallic shape, you realise that it must be a small robot.

^On its lower side it has got tiny wheels, a series of poils and a kind of rubber spatula.

^It is the automatic cleaner that operates on this level.

^It's not moving. You ask it why.

^"Why ain't you moving?"

^Cleaner "I cannot operate in the darkness."

^It's painted in green like all devices related to health and hygiene on the spaceship.

^Voice "It was refusing to operate in the darkness."

recognise_cleaner: ^This clarification by the Voice sounds completely gratuitous.
^You can't help thinking that the Voice is looking down on the simple-minded working-class robot.
^But maybe there's something else going on here.

c-0: ^You know that's not how that AI works, but you are under the impression that the Voice is… jealous.
^Perhaps she doesn't want you to have a connection with another machine.
c-1: ^Perhaps she is trying to show you a way out…
^If the robot is not sentient, "helping" it wouldn't count as helping, taboo-wise.
^You could use the cleaner robot as your safe-conduct.

b: ^ Whatever it is, the robot won't do anything else unless you find a source of light.
^You have a source of light, it can wake up from its stasis and follow you.

smooth_walls: ^This must just be a connection between two areas.
dialogue_1: ^The way the Voice said that "they" are breaching was scary.
^ was struggling to pronounce the words.

c-0: ^"Why were you uncomfortable saying that 'they' are breaching?"
c-1: ^"Can you tell me again what they are doing?"
^"You know who. Those who are breaching."
^Voice "I'D RATHER NOT dwelve upon this subject."
c-2: ^Voice "I'D RATHER NOT talk about their identity."
g-0: ^The Voice said that in a stertorous, trembling, high-pitch tone.
^You remember studying this special voice marker: it's a safety measure in smarter AIs.
^It marks a "taboo", i.e. some special constraint that was superimposed to the AI's original alignment.

c-3: ^Voice "If it were, I wouldn't be able to discuss about it."
^ saying that it's actually a taboo?
c-4: ^"I order you to break the taboo!"
^Voice "Taboos are unbreakable by definition and by design."

g-1: ^Someone must have placed a taboo on this "breach", whatever it is.
^This is crazy, because everyone is hibernated on board, and you cannot imagine the Earth HQ placing an AI taboo on an emergency here.
^Earth, by the way. How fare are they?

c-5: ^It's difficult to imagine that they sent a taboo placement order two years ago.
